title: Verbs Group A (-o)
reading_greek:
THE PATTERN (Stem is Stressed)
- Κάνω (I do)
- Κάνεις (You do)
- Κάνει (He/She does)
- Κάνουμε (We do)
- Κάνετε (You do)
- Κάνουν (They do)

COMMON VERBS
- Μένω (I live/stay)
- Περιμένω (I wait)
- Διαβάζω -> Διαβάζουμε (I read -> We read)
- Γράφω -> Γράφει (I write -> He writes)
- Πίνω (I drink)
- Μαθαίνω (I learn)
- Δουλεύω -> Δουλεύω (I work - I work)
reading_english:
GRAMMAR: GROUP A VERBS [(See Page 54)](/assets/grammar.pdf#page=54)

1. IDENTIFY IT: The accent is on the STEM, not the ending. 
   - KA-no, not ka-NO.

2. ENDINGS:
   - o, eis, ei
   - oume, ete, oun

3. STRESS: The stress usually stays on the same syllable. 
   - KA-no, KA-neis, KA-noume.
audio_script:
Group A Verbs. The biggest family of verbs. 

They are easy to spot. The stress is on the root. 'KA-no', 'ME-no', 'PI-no'.

Conjugation check:
- I: -o
- You: -eis
- He/She: -ei

- We: -oume
- You (pl): -ete
- They: -oun

'Meno' (I live). 'Meneis' (You live). 'Menei' (He lives). 
'Menoume' (We live). 'Menete' (You live). 'Menoun' (They live).

Learn this pattern, and you know 80% of Greek verbs.
